alert.note: Alert for Henry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EASTERN HENRY COUNTY THROUGH 1000 PM EDT... At 929 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northeast of New Castle. Movement was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gratz, Port Royal, Drennon Springs, Delville, Slabtown, Fallis, Lockport, Franklinton, Orville and Lacie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
